com.whirvis.jraknet.scheduler

Class ScheduledTask<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.scheduler.ScheduledTask<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the input to the operation.

    public final class ScheduledTask<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a task that is executed by the SchedulerThread after being scheduled by the Scheduler.
    Since:
    JRakNet v2.11.0
    Author:
    Whirvis T. Wheatley

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int count 
      private boolean executing 
      static int INFINITE
      The task will repeat indefinitely.
      static long INSTANTANEOUS
      The task will execute as soon as possible.
      private long lastExecute 
      private T obj 
      private java.util.function.Consumer<T> operation 
      private boolean sync 
      private long wait

      Creates scheduled task.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScheduledTask

        protected ScheduledTask(boolean sync,
                        T obj,
                        java.util.function.Consumer<T> operation,
                        long wait,
                        int count)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates scheduled task.
        Parameters:
        sync - true if each task execution must finish before the next execution can begin, false otherwise.
        obj - the object to execute the operation on.
        operation - the consumer operation to execute.
        wait - how long to wait before initially executing the task in milliseconds, and how long to wait before executing the task again if it executes more than once. To have the task be executed immediately, use INSTANTANEOUS.
        count - the amount of times the task should be executed. To have the task be executed indefinitely, use INFINITE.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the operation is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the execution count is less than zero and not equal to -1.

    • Method Detail

      • isFinished

        protected boolean isFinished()
        Returns whether or not the task is finished. This does not mean that the task has finished executing, but rather that the task has finished every execution it has.
        Returns:
        true if the task has been finished, false otherwise.

      • shouldExecute

        protected boolean shouldExecute()
        Returns whether or not the task should be executed.
        Returns:
        true if the task should be executed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isFinished(), execute()

      • execute

        protected void execute()
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Executes the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state cannot be executed according to shouldExecute().
